intro: Mitrasacme setosa, commonly known as the hairy mitrasacme, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Mitrasacme setosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
